poem:
**Best Price**

They promise cheapest,  
the liturgy of the screen.  
But the rails have no mercy,  
only distances and delay.

No company makes the fare;  
they sell the same silence  
in different wrappers.

The watchdog barks.  
Still we queue, believing  
the next click will be truth—  
while the track divides:  
split tickets, split selves.
